com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.parser.sql

Class StatementModifier

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.dsm.engine.parser.sql.StatementModifier

  • public class StatementModifier
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds information that modifies the interpretation of a DSM/SLQ statement. A statement modifier has a type and optional data that is type-specific. The types are defined in StatementModifierType enum. Support for parsing modifiers from a text representation are provided in support of a DSM/SQL parser.
    Author:
    dawood

      • fromSpecification

        public static StatementModifier fromSpecification(java.lang.String token)
                                           throws DSMParseException
        Look at a string specification for a statement modifier and parse it into the corresponding modifier. Supports the following:
        • DELETE
        • MSEC=<N>
        • CHOOSE=<N>
        • CHOOSE_MIN=<N>
        • PREVIOUS=<table name>
        Parameters:
        token -
        Returns:
        StatementModifier.None if not recognized.
        Throws:
        DSMParseException

      • getModifier

        public static StatementModifier getModifier(java.lang.String string)
                                     throws DSMParseException
        Look in the given string for a single modifier.
        Parameters:
        string -
        Returns:
        never null.
        Throws:
        DSMParseException

      • stripModifier

        public static java.lang.String stripModifier(java.lang.String str,

                                      throws DSMParseException
        Remove the string token for the given modifier from the given string.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Throws:

      • getType

        public StatementModifier.StatementModifierType getType()
        Returns:

      • getData

        public java.lang.Object getData()
        Get the data associated with the modifier type, if any. Mappings are as follows:
        • StatementModifier.StatementModifierType.Periodic - an Integer representing the periodicity.
        • Any others - null.
        Returns:
        the data
